11:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: so wdyt about I write a SectionEditingTransformation? That tx would be located in platform/core/xwiki-rendering since it needs DAB (for testing edit right). Actually it also needs getSectionEditingDepth() but that could be a new tx config property (which is better IMO). Note that havng a tx means that section editing can be turned on/off easily too  
11:09 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: done  
11:10 <@sdumitriu> Thanks  
11:10 <+sburjan> I'm gonna continue with other pages of documentation  
11:10 <+sburjan> Actually gonna continue with this one, some screenshots need to be updated also  
11:12 <+tmortagne> what would it do ? just put some marker which is then used to insert buttons, right ? I wouldn't like a rendering transformation trying putting buttons on an XDOM which is not done for that.  
11:13 <+tmortagne> that could also be done at XHTMLRenderer level or an extension XHTML renderer  
11:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: it adds a span and an anchor  
11:13 <+tmortagne> but would be coomplex to use at XHTMLRenderer level  
11:13 <vmassol> s/anchor/a href  
11:13 <vmassol> it's better at TX level IMO  
11:13 <vmassol> for lots of reasons  
11:14 <+tmortagne> it's also bad for other reason like the fact that it add stuff which only make sense in the xhtml rendered in your proposal  
11:14 <vmassol> why?  
11:15 <vmassol> I mean why does it make sense only for the xhtml renderer?  
11:15 <vmassol> I don't see any reason  
11:15 <+tmortagne> what this button means in an exported pdf which is not editable ?  
11:16 <+tmortagne> also you will have to support rights  
11:16 <vmassol> the same as any link in the content  
11:16 <+tmortagne> since you are not going to generate button all the time  
11:16 <dirk\_> has quit  
11:16 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not exactly  
11:16 <+tmortagne> links are part of the content  
11:16 <+tmortagne> here you are adding UI stuff  
11:16 <+tmortagne> that's two very different things  
11:16 <vmassol> sure bnut I don't agree it's related to html  
11:17 <+tmortagne> it's related to UI  
11:17 <vmassol> yes that's more lie it  
11:17 <vmassol> but even then  
11:17 <+tmortagne> so not the content  
11:17 <+tmortagne> XDOM is content  
11:17 <vmassol> someone might still want to have it in the exported pdf  
11:17 <vmassol> for ex  
11:17 <vmassol> imagine we want to print the XE documentation  
11:17 <vmassol> we might want to show these edit section links in it  
11:18 <vmassol> or not  
11:18 <+tmortagne> in a paper ?  
11:18 <vmassol> I mean the use case is mostly not to see them  
11:18 <vmassol> but some people might want exact "screenshots"  
11:18 <vmassol> I'd prefer  
11:18 <vmassol> to say  
11:18 <vmassol> that depending on the use case the list of tx to run can be different  
11:19 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure we need that anyway  
11:19 <vmassol> tx is just rendering extensions actually  
11:19 <vmassol> (or can be considered like this)  
11:19 <vmassol> rendering as in the whole process not renderers  
11:20 <vmassol> indeed we don't have the notion of post renderer extension yet  
11:20 <vmassol> but in this case I don't see why it would be absolutely needed  
11:20 <vmassol> in any case even if it were needed it shouldn't be implemented as extending the renderer  
11:21 <vmassol> but as some extension like tx but for post rendering  
11:21 <vmassol> (which we agreed is costly)
